title: Cyber bullying
body: This has gone too far... im literally on the verge of crying because of a video game that i am suppose to enjoy. I have got people literally bully me in game and not just calling me names but all out just insulting every little thing of me and even if i mute them i can still see the words that has already been said. this isnt fun, for anyone.  im pretty sure everyone has been bullied but this...this is different. Posting videos on youtube literally shaming u infront of the world is such out right dumb. deosnt mean u never got bullied b4 means u have the right to do it to others. im not even going to try to make up some fancy bullshit. this has to fucking stop. why am i being harres fro playing a video game where i can and am suppose to enjoy. idk if this happens al over the regions or just oce but im sick of this. im even thinking of paying that $15 just so i can move to NA or just quiting

replies.body: Wow, helpful..
It is true though.

TL;DR It's not. 

The idea that video games are _supposed_ to contain malice, and everyone has to _accept that_ is just sick. If you think accepting malice, and being a part of it is "growing up", then you haven't grown up. This excuse is used by people who lack self-control and NEED it to be accepted to protect themselves from being punished & looked down upon for their own abusive behavior.

To "handle" being insulted by people, is to accept abuse as normal and desensitize yourself to it's effects. This is something that humans (particularly young children) who undergo severe abuse/torture do as a sanity/survival mechanism. The survivors go on to live without empathy, and have no capacity for human connection. In other words, by definition, they go on to be psychopaths.

Eg. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VDVaiwzU8yc

It's in our nature to be sensitive to the ideas, intent and communication of others - some more than others, but we can't punish/disadvantage someone for being more empathetic/sensitive than the rest. The abuser is always in the wrong, the same way the abusive adult is in the wrong in my scenario. And the only ones who won't see/admit that are the abusers themselves. 

You might be thinking "that's physical abuse, these are just words on the internet. You can't compare them lol". Think again. It's not the physical abuse that causes psychopathy in children, the same way it's not the actual words that hurt, it's the severity of the intent and malice behind them. It's all mental, the form of the abuse is just a medium for the expression of that intent.

To try to toughen our skin to the point of desensitisation is to disregard something so natural and beautiful it's often considered the key to life satisfaction.

Riot recognises it's wrong, and is constantly working on ways to eradicate it because IT'S NOT PART OF THE GAME. And if you can't accept that it's wrong, then you don't deserve to be part of the game either.
Wish I could up-vote that one billion times and then some. Well said.
Thanks :)

TL:DR it is though.

Its not abuse endemic in gaming. Its a teenager calling you a scrub.

I just dont let that get to me - prefer to divert my energies elsewhere.

You're enabled with a mute button. One simple button click and you remove their power. Only you let their words hurt you.

Ever been to the toxic comments in the telegraph? Ever been to reddit? 4chan? Ever commented on a public post on facebook or had an argument with a stranger about a political issue?  This problem is not unique to gaming and certainly not unique to LoL. This is a symptom of internet anonymity, not an expectation of malice in gaming.

It is called the "online disinhibition effect"
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Online_disinhibition_effect

This has been the subject of academic study published in respected peer reviewed journals (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/15257832).

And a quick google will show you that this is not riot's problem to solve - you immediately get a sense of the fact that this problem exists in a far greater sphere than LoL, and a far greater sphere than gaming.

http://www.scientificamerican.com/article/why-is-everyone-on-the-internet-so-angry/

http://www.newyorker.com/tech/elements/the-psychology-of-online-comments

https://www.techinasia.com/why-are-people-rude-online

http://www.chathamdailynews.ca/2015/01/25/online-anonymity-form-of-deindividuation

http://www.empowher.com/relationships-amp-family/content/anonymity-makes-people-rude-editorial

I commend riot for providing the mute button to "manage" the issue (ie the ability to mute) and player behavior inititatives (to kick out the REALLY bad apples), but these are tools to manage the issue - it is too big an issue to expect riot to solve.

It is just a fact that the world has dickheads, and the dickhead effect is amplified when people are protected by a veil of anonymity, turning those who are normally quite reserved and reasonable people in person into toxic tools online.

Gaming may intensify the frequency of unpleasant interactions because of the reliance on those in your team, but the fact remains that when people are shielded by anonymity (whether it be in gaming or other online environments where commenting and interaction is encouraged) they say things they would not dream of saying in real life or face to face.

And although not the most confident person in the world, I am more than confident enough in myself to give online abuse the attention and respect it deserves. (none).

Getting angry at online mockery is about as constructive as having a 4 hour spirited discussion with a coconut. Ultimately pointless and a complete waste of your time and energy.

If you want to let the words of a 14 year old virgin ruin your day go right ahead, but I can tell you that it wont stop once you leave LoL, and if you have any intention of contributing to any open discussion on the internet, you're gonna have a bad time if you let every neckbeard ruin your day with a taunt.

True cyber bullying - using an electronic communication service to communicate death threats, legitimate threats to the safety of your family, constant personal targeted abuse from those known to the victim in real life - is a very real issue. But in game chat in a video game? No. That is just disinhibition in action from random people you are unlikely to play with again and even more unlikely to meet in real life, and not to be confused with legitimate cyberbullying which is targeted, ongoing, and malicious. And certainly nothing that can't be reported for immediate action if it even hints at getting serious.

The only power these people have over you is when YOU let their words hurt you. And the only person who's behavior you can control is your own. Set an example of the sort of behavior you'd like to see, and ignore the losers who are epic tough guys only when anonymous.
NOICE!

Why should you learn how to be insulted by other people? It's just a game, no need to insult anyone over it.

People commit suicide due to being bullied, it's a serious issue, stop making light of it!

> Why should you learn how to be insulted by other people?

^

mfw the most helpful tip is downvoted 8 times lol.. what a joke.

Everywhere you go people will bully you if you let them, it's up to you to overcome their petty ways, with league it's so easy to avoid with the mute button. Don't mute all, mute people who get to you.  :)
And it has now been deleted.

see this is why our community ( i saw community lightly) is one of the worse, he has  valid point and all of you just attack him. learn o be a better committing aqnd hopefully we wont be ranked number 1 worst server.

Hey man,

I'm really sorry you went through an experience like that in our game. Some people lack a lot of empathy especially when it comes to online behaviour. I just wanted to raise more visibility to a great post by ArcticHorizon in response to some of the comments here that say "grow up" or "toughen up". Making someone feel the way you felt after that game is not okay.

Below is the [comment by ArcticHorizon](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/lM1zpcAN-cyber-bullying?comment=0006000000000000)
> TL;DR It's not. 
> 
> The idea that video games are _supposed_ to contain malice, and everyone has to _accept that_ is just sick. If you think accepting malice, and being a part of it is "growing up", then you haven't grown up. This excuse is used by people who lack self-control and NEED it to be accepted to protect themselves from being punished & looked down upon for their own abusive behavior.
> 
> To "handle" being insulted by people, is to accept abuse as normal and desensitize yourself to it's effects. This is something that humans (particularly young children) who undergo severe abuse/torture do as a sanity/survival mechanism. The survivors go on to live without empathy, and have no capacity for human connection. In other words, by definition, they go on to be psychopaths.
> 
> Eg. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VDVaiwzU8yc
> 
> It's in our nature to be sensitive to the ideas, intent and communication of others - some more than others, but we can't punish/disadvantage someone for being more empathetic/sensitive than the rest. The abuser is always in the wrong, the same way the abusive adult is in the wrong in my scenario. And the only ones who won't see/admit that are the abusers themselves. 
> 
> You might be thinking "that's physical abuse, these are just words on the internet. You can't compare them lol". Think again. It's not the physical abuse that causes psychopathy in children, the same way it's not the actual words that hurt, it's the severity of the intent and malice behind them. It's all mental, the form of the abuse is just a medium for the expression of that intent.
> 
> To try to toughen our skin to the point of desensitisation is to disregard something so natural and beautiful it's often considered the key to life satisfaction.
> 
> Riot recognises it's wrong, and is constantly working on ways to eradicate it because IT'S NOT PART OF THE GAME. And if you can't accept that it's wrong, then you don't deserve to be part of the game either.

You can read more about all the things we are doing on our player behaviour FAQ - http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behaviour/Y9YJ60Fn-player-behaviour-faq

Once again, I'm really sorry you had to go through an experience like that. I would suggest trying to find a regular group of friends to play with, try look on the boards (I saw some players offering to play with you in the comments too) or joining a facebook community - [Summoners Society](https://www.facebook.com/groups/SummonersSocietyOCE/) - is a great positive community.

If you report someone mid-game, move the chat box off the screen.
That way you won't see anything :)
I like you.

Mute, report, and get on with your life.

Dont get upset about 14 year old virgin neckbeards calling you the bad words. Just not worth it.

If someone is posting videos shaming you, report them in a [Support Ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) with your evidence. For in-game behavior I suggest simply muting them at the first sign of toxicity. There's probably no real need to automatically mute everyone. If you feel their behavior should not be allowed at all, report them at the end of the match.

They are nobody important to you and you're unlikely to see them ever again, so don't give them your attention.

Moving to NA will change literally nothing.

You can have videos removed and have players punished by submitting Support Tickets with evidence. Other than that, block people you don't want to hear from and mute people in game. You can also play with friends (or make some if you don't have any) so at least your teammates won't be abusive. You need to realise that their words mean nothing, their actions don't matter, and that quite often, they're likely wrong in what they are saying. 

If you need people to play with then add me on either this account or Kylar Alice (I play on Kylar Alice more).
big baby get over it or stop playing tern 18 get out into the real world and see what happens there this is nothing.

Sorry, but you can never justify bullying. Simply saying there is worse out there doesn't make this situation acceptable. Maybe if we can cut out the small stuff (this situation btw is not minor), the worse stuff you elude too might get better too.

I have played in NA before the server transfer which screw my ping, and let me say this they are hundreds time better than OCE. Even with all the memes and etc on how toxic NA LoL players is, you wouldn't even know that until you play in OCE. OCE is by far the most toxic, racist, point finger blaming when they're terrible players and the sad part is, these trolls will always find a way to find out about your religion, race or face feature to use it as an insult. 

Do not believe what all these people saying in this thread when they say it'll happen in other region too, because I've been in NA since S4 and non of their insult came as close to what OCE people does. At least on other region the toxicity is somewhat funny and only related to your performance of the game or your in game name. OCE on the other hand is just plain ridiculous.

If the ping is decent for you to play in NA, then I suggest for you to just transfer. Most people are stuck in OCE due to the recent NA server change which screw up lots of players. I for one had my ping increased from 170 to 300 and now are forced to play in OCE for eternity.

Ehm, no. In OCE clearly we have multiple races from multiple country playing in it and all of us will have this generic name and generic way of typing/slang in chat which can easily be identified where we're from. Its mostly on the player fault for having CN/KR/TW/NZ on their name or they have names that identified where they're from. Such thing is easily exploited and OCE players tend to jump into that and use it instead of you know being a dickhead and saying your team sucks. 

Even if they're wrong on the toxicity on a target, what makes you think other players are not affected by the racist remarks? Just because lots of people doing it, doesn't mean it is the right thing to do. And please spare yourselves from saying " But eyy, those bastid are the one that expose themselves ayye with their name and how they chat/language they use you %%%%?" because that is a pretty stupid argument.

Am I the only one disappointed that there wasn't  a link to the youtube video????

To the OP - mute them then spam the chatbox if it bothers you so much, the chatbox doesn't stay there forever.

It's in every game you play buddy. It's mostly people who are awful or having a hard time in real life. Just makes them feel better to upset everyone. Just mute or ignore all the comments. Or just play with your real life friends

Sounds like you need to take a break and do other things.. You're becoming too emotionally connected.. It's just a game. Sure you want to win, but it's not hard to ignore the comments. It's as simple as muting the person.

I actually find it very funny when people insult me, even if I do good I still got flamed. People wished me to die, to get cancer, they said they want that all my beloved die today and so on...also, like 30% of them said that they slept with my mother. I usually respond with "xD" or "that was really funny" and I make it in a playful way and they don't even know how to react. Also, I find strange, but sometimes I got honors from the one that insulted me while I was in game with them. Let me explain a little trick that maybe will help you avoid being insulted. Ask them a favor. Like...let's say you're jungler and you see your top lane pushing like there is no tommorow and die, and then blame you for not helping him. Say "Could you ward that tribush for me?". You don't really need vision there, but they usually will do what you say and they will look at you in a better way, because you know, you don't do favors for the ones you hate. So this way, if you're asking a favor that isn't really a favor and be playful with them, they can even start to like you :) Hope I was useful for you, have a good day.

Hey, if ur on the internet contribute maybe contribute something useful either than sitting on your ass all day writing mean comments about stuff u dont like. Come back when u have something to contribute and grow a pear? some age u are telling people that. grow up and be anactual adult

and well if your good enough no to be low elo and your still suffering just play with friends and try not to get your self a victim of bullying.

Sadly this happens in every game, thank god LoL doesn't have voice chat, because of a few things. First is children who don't know what sportsmanship is because I know if my mum caught me going on like that, even today, she'd take the computer off me. But there are also people who are just (word I shouldn't say on the forums) who just take enjoyment from being like that to people, I've always said that those people are truely sad but they keep apearing.

Also if they're posting abusive videos about you, on youtube atleast, you can report them as harrasment.
